Detailed Description

Class that models the hosportal message database.

It basically is an interface class between the hosportal module and the hosportal message database. This class provides functions to insert, sort, edit and delete entries in the database.

Author:
Salman Noor
MIU Intern
School of Electrical Engineering, WITS Unversity
Version:
0.68
Date:
May 3, 2010
Warning:
This class's parent is dbTable which is a chisimba core class.
If the dbTable class is altered. This class may not work.
Apart from normal PHP. This class uses the mysql language to provide actual functionality. This language is encapsulated with in "double quotes" in a string format.

Definition at line 418 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

init (  ) 

Constructor that set up this class.

It defines the table tbl_hosportal_messages and creates private data members from other classes for this class to use.

Define the table tbl_hosportal_messages. This can only be done if this class is inherited by dbTable.

Instatiate an object user from the class user_module.

Instatiate an object DBOriginalComments from the class dbhosportal_original_messages.

Instatiate an object DBReplies from the class dbhosportal_replies.

Definition at line 55 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

insertSingle ( $  title,
$  comments,
$  unreplied,
$  noofreplies 
)

Member function to insert a new entry into the messages database.

Parameters:
title A string. It is the subject matter of the entry.
comments A string. It is the comment of the entry.
unreplied A Boolean Value. It is to determine whether the entry has been replied to or not.
noofreplies A Integer. how many replies this entry has.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Returns:
An automatically generated unique id for that new entry.

Get the user's name that is inserting the entry.

Insert the entry into the database with its relevant fields. If succesful, store the entries id into a temporary variable. The insert function is from the parent class dbTable.

return an automatically generated unique id for that new entry.

Definition at line 219 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

insertSingleOriginalMessage ( $  id,
$  title,
$  comments,
$  unreplied,
$  noofreplies 
)

Member function to insert a new entry into the messages AND original messages database.

Parameters:
title A string. It is the subject matter of the entry.
comments A string. It is the comment of the entry.
unreplied A Boolean Value. It is to determine whether the entry has been replied to or not.
noofreplies A Integer. how many replies this entry has.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Returns:
An automatically generated unique id for that new entry.

Get the user's name that is inserting the entry.

Insert the entry into the messages database with its relevant fields. If succesful, store the entries id into a temporary variable. The insert function is from the parent class dbTable.

Insert the entry into the original messages database with its relevant fields. If succesful, store the entries id into a temporary variable. The insert function is from the class dbhosportal_original_messages.

Notice the id values for the same entry that is stored in two different databases are the SAME.

Definition at line 249 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

insertSingleReply ( $  id,
$  title,
$  comments,
$  unreplied,
$  noofreplies 
)

Member function to insert a new reply entry into the messages AND replies database. param id A string. This id is from the message the reply belongs to.

Parameters:
title A string. It is the subject matter of the entry. It will be the same
comments A string. It is the comment of the entry.
unreplied A Boolean Value. It is to determine whether the entry has been replied to or not.
noofreplies A Integer. how many replies this entry has.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Returns:
An automatically generated unique id for that new entry.

Get the user's name that is inserting the reply entry.

Insert the entry into the messages database with its relevant fields. If succesful, store the entries id into a temporary variable. The insert function is from the parent class dbTable.

Insert the entry into the replies database with its relevant fields. If succesful, store the entries id into a temporary variable. The insert function is from the class dbhosportal_replies.

Notice the id values for the same entry that is stored in two different databases are the SAME.

Definition at line 72 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

listComment ( $  comments  ) 

Member function to search the entire database for a certain comment and return it.

Parameters:
comments A string. The comment could be any small part of the entire comment. Examples choosing the word "can" in a comment that contains the word "canister". The modulus signs % allows you to do this.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Returns:
A string that contains the entire comment.

Definition at line 87 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

listSingle ( $  id  ) 

Member function to return a single entry with a specific id.

Parameters:
id A string. This Id is generated by mysql and in unique for all entries. the Id is assigned when you create an entry in the database.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Make sure you pass the correct id for the entry you want.
Returns:
A single entry with all its fields from the database.

Definition at line 205 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

sortByAuthorAtoZ (  ) 

Member function to sort all entries by author A to Z and return that result as an array.

Returns:
An array with the all messages sorted by by author A to Z

Select all or * entries from the table hosportal messages and order them by the field author asc and store the result in a temporary variable. The language MYSQL is used to do this.It is important to note that no changes are being made in the database.

Convert the temporary variable into an array and return it.

Definition at line 123 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

sortByAuthorZtoA (  ) 

Member function to sort all entries by author Z to A and return that result as an array.

Returns:
An array with the all messages sorted by by author Z to A.

Select all or * entries from the table hosportal messages and order them by the field author in desc order and store the result in a temporary variable. The language MYSQL is used to do this.It is important to note that no changes are being made in the database.

Convert the temporary variable into an array and return it.

Definition at line 95 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

sortByLeastReplies (  ) 

Member function to sort all entries by least replies and return that result as an array.

Returns:
An array with the all messages sorted by by least replies.

Select all or * entries from the table hosportal messages and order them by the field replies in asc order and store the result in a temporary variable. The language MYSQL is used to do this.It is important to note that no changes are being made in the database.

Convert the temporary variable into an array and return it.

Definition at line 161 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

updateSingle ( $  id,
$  title,
$  comments,
$  unreplied,
$  noofreplies 
)

Member function to edit an existing entry in the messages database.

Parameters:
id A string. Unique caller id for the exsiting entry.
title A string. It is the edited or the same subject matter for the exisitng entry.
comments A string. It is the edited or the same comment for the exisitng entry.
unreplied A Boolean Value. It is to determine whether the entry has been replied to or not.
noofreplies A Integer. How many replies this entry has.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
MAKE SURE you have the correct id as the wrong id will edit the wrong entry
Returns:
The same id for that exisiting entry.

Get the user's name that is editing the exisitng entry.

Update the entry into the database with its relevant fields. If succesful, store the entries id into a temporary variable. The update function is from the parent class dbTable.

return the same id for that exisitng entry. The id does not change.

Definition at line 318 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

updateSingleOriginalMessage ( $  id,
$  title,
$  comments,
$  unreplied,
$  noofreplies 
)

Member function to edit an existing entry in the messages AND original messages database.

Parameters:
id A string. Unique caller id for the exsiting entry.
title A string. It is the edited or the same subject matter for the exisitng entry.
comments A string. It is the edited or the same comment for the exisitng entry.
unreplied A Boolean Value. It is to determine whether the entry has been replied to or not.
noofreplies A Integer. The update or same value of how many replies this entry has.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
MAKE SURE you have the correct id as the wrong id will edit the wrong entry
Returns:
The same id for that exisiting entry.

Get the user's name that is editing the exisitng entry.

Update the entry into the database with its relevant fields. If successful, store the entries id into a temporary variable. The update function is from the parent class dbTable.

Update the entry into the original messages database with its relevant fields. If succesful, store the entry's id into a temporary variable. The update function is from the class dbhosportal_original_messages.

Notice the id values for the same entry that is update in two different databases are the SAME.

Definition at line 343 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

updateSingleReply ( $  id,
$  title,
$  comments,
$  unreplied,
$  noofreplies 
)

Member function to edit an existing entry in the messages AND replies database.

Parameters:
id A string. Unique caller id for the exsiting entry.
title A string. It is the edited or the same subject matter for the exisitng entry.
comments A string. It is the edited or the same comment for the exisitng entry.
unreplied A Boolean Value. It is to determine whether the entry has been replied to or not.
noofreplies A Integer. The update or same value of how many replies this entry has.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
MAKE SURE you have the correct id as the wrong id will edit the wrong entry
Returns:
The same id for that exisiting entry.

Get the user's name that is editing the exisitng entry.

Update the entry into the database with its relevant fields. If successful, store the entries id into a temporary variable. The update function is from the parent class dbTable.

Update the entry into the replies database with its relevant fields. If succesful, store the entry's id into a temporary variable. The update function is from the class dbhosportal_relies.

Notice the id values for the same entry that is update in two different databases are the SAME.

Definition at line 370 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

Field Documentation

$objDBOriginalComments [private]

Private data member of class dbhosportal_messages that stores an object of another class.

This class is composed of one object from the dbhosportal_original_messages class. Similiar to this class, this object provides the same functionality but for a different database called tbl_hosportal_original_messages.

$objDBReplies [private]

Private data member of class dbhosportal_messages that stores an object of another class.

This class is composed of one object from the dbhosportal_replies class. Similiar to this class, this object provides the similiar functionality but for a different database called tbl_hosportal_replies.

Definition at line 47 of file dbhosportal_messages_class_inc.php.

$objUser [private]

Private data member of class dbhosportal_messages that stores an object of another class.

This class is composed of one object from the user_module class in the utilities module of chisimba. This object provides options to manipulate and utilize user data.
